title: Zdeno Chara’s 10 most memorable moments with the Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Zdeno Chara named to the Hockey Hall of Fame for his achievements with the Boston Bruins.
Chara's Bruins career included winning the Stanley Cup and setting an NHL hardest shot record.
Chara played in the 2019 Stanley Cup Final with a broken jaw, showing immense resilience.

title: Bill Belichick reflects on ‘learning curve’ during first season coaching college football
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick coached UNC Tar Heels to a 4-5 record, aiming to match last year's six-win total.
Belichick admits a learning curve in adapting to college football after decades in the NFL.
With three games left, UNC seeks bowl eligibility, needing to achieve at least a .500 regular-season record.

title: Patriots have 15 players land on injury report, but get some good news
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fifteen Patriots players appeared on the injury report ahead of their Thursday night game against the Jets.
Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson were limited participants, indicating progress from their previous injuries.
Austin Hooper missed the team's walkthrough on Monday due to a concussion, while several others were limited.

title: Georgia man allegedly stole millions in unclaimed Mass. property
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Shaka Stayman of Atlanta faces 25 counts related to stealing millions in unclaimed Massachusetts property.
Stayman allegedly filed fraudulent claims totaling $3.3 million and cashed checks for $1.1 million.
Investigators blocked $2.2 million in claims; Stayman set for December sentencing in a separate federal case.

title: TreVeyon Henderson explained why he looked at the sideline during key TD run
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: TreVeyon Henderson scored a key touchdown with less than two minutes left after glancing at the sideline for guidance.
Henderson wasn't sure whether to score or run down the clock, but decided to score, securing a career-best performance.
Rhamondre Stevenson is out and Terrell Jennings is injured; Patriots to evaluate running back options in a short week.

title: Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei returned to the Bruins lineup on Saturday and recorded two assists in a 5-3 victory over Toronto.
Lohrei had been benched for five games by coach Marco Sturm due to defensive struggles prior to his return.
Other players like Casey Mittelstadt have also responded well to benchings, improving performance after being scratched.

title: Petitioners gathering signatures to repeal legal marijuana accused of misleading voters
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Petitioners for a marijuana repeal initiative in Massachusetts are accused of misleading voters while gathering signatures.
State officials received complaints of signers being misled or not fully understanding the petition they signed.
The Coalition for a Healthy Massachusetts denies wrongdoing, while critics label the gathering as 'organized voter fraud.'

title: Massachusetts state payroll hits $9B in 2025 — UMass system dominates
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts state payroll reached $9.19 billion in 2025, a decrease from $10.26 billion in the previous year.
UMass dominated with all top 15 highest-paid state employees, led by Men's Basketball Head Coach Frank Martin at $1.96 million.
UMass payroll totaled $1.55 billion, surpassing MBTA and the Trial Court, which had $799.68 million and $574.67 million, respectively.

title: Mass. State Police: 56 arrested in three-day child exploitation sweep
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Operation Firewall led to the arrest of 56 individuals in Massachusetts during a three-day child exploitation effort.
Authorities seized 229 electronic devices and executed 34 search warrants linked to child pornography and online enticement.
Charges include possession of child pornography, failing to register as sex offenders, and arranging sex online with undercover officers.

title: 5 ways to help fight food insecurity in the North Shore right now
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: SNAP benefits restoration begins, but over a million in Massachusetts still need food support.
Opportunities to combat food insecurity include volunteering at Beverly Bootstraps or donating to Salem Pantry.
Lynn Community Fridge and The Open Door in Gloucester offer additional ways to help feed North Shore residents.
